alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 17 at 7:40AM AKST until November 19 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...No additional snow is expected during this event. Reduced visibilities are expected to due to winds lifting and blowing transportable snow already on the ground.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
